content.description: Tricky start to an easy finish
content.protection: 4” cam, bolts. Optional slings, and one optional 2” cam to protect the last move before the anchor. Chain ancor.
content.location: Start in the shallow diedeal, protect the move with a 4” cam. Once on top of the boulder climb the easier face to a small roof. After the roof, easy climb brings to the anchor (shared with the other climbs on this face).

content.description: Climb the corner on the right of Java Time. The crux is transitioning from the corner to the left arete, after that, easy climb to the top.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a chain ancor. An optional 2” cam protects the last move before the anchor.
content.location: The right diedral on the right of Java Time. The bolts are on the obvious vertical smooth face.

content.description: Fun route with a tricky start, going over the small bulge at the top is not as hard as it looks.
content.location: To the right of Frogs Roof.

climbs.name: Hoss
climbs.fa: Barry Chambers and Bruce Boe July 2011

content.description: The fact that this superb crack is hidden behind a huge fir tree probably explains why it escaped any attention until 2011! It's a straight forward hand crack that widens slightly as it ascends the cliff. It starts in a tiny alcove, so the start is overhanging a little bit, which makes the route unique.
content.protection: Single cams to a #4 Camalot (4.5") will probably suffice, although a green Alien in the horizontal seam is nice to have if you don't have a lot of bigger gear.
content.location: This is on  Lower Quarter Day Dome, to the right of But Pa, behind the big fir tree and a big boulder. You won't see it until you go up to the tree and look. Then you'll be stoked you did.

content.description: 5.7 start up the flake leads to a right-facing corner with a finger crack/ramp up to the left (5.6 from here up). Corner zigzags back right and you can either continue on the hollow flake or use face holds out left. Climb face straight up to anchor.
content.protection: Nuts (offsets work nicely); single cams from #0.1 X4 to #3 Camalot. Many slings. Chain anchor.
content.location: Quarter Day Dome - Lower, Bonanza Wall Left. Scramble up large blocks from the approach trail, left of the large tree separating the Lower wall into 2 sections (Bonanza Wall Left and Bonanza Wall Right). Drop down into a ledge/cave to belay. Rap off.

content.description: Climb a crack to a small roof, climb over roof to anchors, super fun route.
content.protection: Pro on the start bolts after that to the anchors.

climbs.name: But Pa
climbs.fa: Barry Chambers and Bruce Boe July 2007

content.description: Barry and Bruce created a fun, steep, and varied sport route here. Relentless steep crimps and pinches down low yield slowly to a  more forgiving face above. Rap links at the top. Use this route to rap off of the splitter crack Hoss.
content.location: This wall is the right side of the formation, a little lower. It's referred to as Lower Quarter Day Dome in the guidebook. Find it just to the left of the gorgeous big Red Fir tree, about 20' left of the hidden splitter crack Hoss.
